results.title: Critical choice
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. The film considers the cost of high-risk organ transplants and the allocation of scarce medical resources. A child is in need of a liver transplant. The child has only a 40% chance of surviving with the transplant, but a 100% chance of dying without it. How should society’s limited medical dollars be spent?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Courage of one's convictions
results.creator_credit: Gil Cardinal, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern technology. Because of her religious convictions, a seventeen-year-old girl refuses medical treatment that will prolong her life. Her decision remains firm in spite of the pleas of her physician, who begins to question who has the right to determine a person’s life or death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Cardinal, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Chronic problem
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film considers the chronic patient’s right to quality care, and the acutely ill patient’s right to a hospital bed. Jean is suffering from multiple sclerosis and is almost completely paralyzed. It seems that the only ones who care about her are the nurses. With the arrival of a patient in need of an operation, it becomes apparent that chronic patients have little priority.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Just one of those things (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James Burge, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dependent Future Pt. 1”.
A film about the hopes, joys and fears of a group of mentally handicapped children and their parents. They live in Swadlincote in Derbyshire where since 1971 all mentally handicapped children have been educated in ordinary schools

results.title: A Woman of the outback
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Robyn Ingram lives and works with her husband and two small children on an isolated sheep station 200km. from the nearest town, Wentworth in N.S.W. The program observes Robyn at work on the farm, as teacher to her small children and on brief visits to friends on a neighbouring farm and in the city, and speculates on the pluses and minuses of such an isolated life. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Woman
results.brief_description: A series narrated by Judy Morris and introduced by Franca Arena, depicting the diversity in the lives of seven individual women of the Asian and Australian region. Each episode is devoted to exploring their roles in the home, at work and within their own cultures.

results.title: An immigrant woman
results.creator_credit: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Wong King Chan is a Chinese immigrant living and working in extremely hard conditions in Macau. Her factory work takes her away from her husband and two children for at least ten hours a day, then she returns to the tiny one room flat in a tenement building they share with three others. As we follow her daily routine we learn of her hopes to save enough money to buy a flat which will generate enough income to provide for her children’s education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A Woman of Sri Lanka
results.creator_credit: Sisira Suraweera, Gian Manara, SLRC Sri Lanka, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Udayani is a young Sri Lankan wife and mother who lives in a village near Kandy. She lives a simple traditional life rooted in Buddhist beliefs and customs. She is shown at work in the fields and at home, visiting the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy at the time of an important festival and assisting in the preparations for her younger sister’s marriage. The program is introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sisira Suraweera, Gian Manara, SLRC Sri Lanka, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
